plugins.name: Color contrast matrix
plugins.description: Need to test your color palette for WCAG 2.1 AA compliance? Not sure which of your color combos are accessible? Enter the hex values of your palette, and this will output a matrix showing the compatibility of EVERY color combination. Red / cross for fail, green / tick for 4.5:1 contrast (AA compliant for all text/UI elements), and yellow / warn for 3:1 contrast (AA compliant for large text/UI elements, but not small text).
plugins.tagline: Check WCAG contrast compatibility of your whole color palette.

93740.name: Color contrast matrix
93740.description: Need to test your color palette for WCAG 2.1 AA compliance? Not sure which of your color combos are accessible? Red / cross for fail, green / tick for 4.5:1 contrast (AA compliant for all text/UI elements), and yellow / warn for 3:1 contrast (AA compliant for large text/UI elements, but not small text).
93740.tagline: Check WCAG contrast compatibility of your whole color palette.

plugins.name: exportColorInGamut
plugins.description:
Figma/Figjam export color in correct gamut


> Note: This plugin is aimed at developers/designers working with a environment/monitor that supports a color space with a wider gamut than sRGB (specifivally p3). Figma running in a browser is limited to sRGB currently, however the desktop app supports the option to use the native OS one. You may need to enable this in the settings under: Figma > Preferences > Color Space > Unmanaged.


Motivation


When working in a wider color gamut (like the display of a modern macbook, supporting p3) and copying colors to be rendered on the web you may find them to look different (notably less saturated), to what you designed. This is to some extent an inevitable consequence of converting to a smaller color gamut (sRGB), as some colors simply cannot be represented there. There are two main strategies, each with benefits and drawbacks, to convert p3 colors to sRGB (or any larger color space to a smaller). Either you scale the colors linearly, always maintaining contrast (so two different colors in p3 will look different in sRGB), but loosing perceptual uniformity (most colors will look notably different, as a consequence of the linear mapping to a smaller color space).


The second approach is implemented in this plugin. There we ensure that a color which is in both color spaces stays perceptually uniform (looks the same), but neglect that on the extreme end of the p3 color space (regarding colors that cannot be represented in sRGB) colors are cut off. So e.g. the reddest red in p3 gets mapped to reddest red in sRGB, but so do all reds in p3 that exceed the reddes red in sRGB.


Implementation

The specific implementation outlined above is by colorjs.io.


Note that this is not the only solution for this problem. As of recently the web is no longer sRGB limited. The new CSS Color Module Level 4 specifies the color() function with which we can represent colors in wider color spaces, when supported. Hence we can use it to more directly "copy" values from figma to the css. Copy is in quotes here because there is no direct copy button in figma to do this. In essence it is a 1 to 1 mapping (of course), only in a slightly different syntax (base 1, instead of base 255). This plugin formats a string containing both approaches, first the new css color() function, then the computed mapping to sRGB. In correct order, so that the sRGB version is used as fallback, if the client browser does not support the new API. Depending on the adaption progress of the CSS Color Module Level 4 spec, you may opt to omit the sRGB version of coverage is sufficiant.


> Note that this plugin is currently only aimed displays/environment using the p3 color space, if you are on a different one (that is supported by colorjs.io, please write me / submit a issue and I will try to make it more modular)


Usage


Select any element, and run the plugin. A string like the following will be copied to your clipboard:


background: rgb(71.942% 0% 5.7326%);
background: color(display-p3 0.6583 0.1125 0.1125);


Limitations


Gradient fills and opacity are not supported yet. If you need them, please write me / submit an issue and I will try to add this feature.


This plugin is intentionally only concerned with filled colors (text, strokes, background...) editable in figma. If you want to export an asset in the correct color space, please refer to Export PNG with Color Profile.

accepted.name: Maximilian Mairinger
accepted.description: Web advocate, passionate about Typescript, image compression, UI design and emergency medicine. Currently, studying AI at JKU.

plugins.tagline: Export colors in wider color space with wider gamut (p3). With properly interpolated sRGB fallback.

plugins.name: Dual Font Master
plugins.description:
New Release: "Dual Font Master" Figma Plugin


What the Plugin Can Do

  1. Register text styles for English and Japanese to apply to your designs.
  2. Apply these registered text styles to your design data.
  3. When registering text styles, set the font weight to 'Auto' to carry over the original font weight.
  4. Instantly preview chosen styles to see exactly how they will look in your design.


Points to Note

  1. When setting the font weight to "Auto", please make sure that the font weight before modification is also present in the modified text. If no corresponding font family is found for the modified font, the font weight "Regular" will be set automatically.
  2. The plugin cannot process text nodes where font family or font weight attributes are set to 'mixed'.


Use Cases

Ideal for global digital products, multilingual marketing materials, and UI/UX design of websites. It maintains font consistency while enabling smooth language transitions, streamlining the design process.


License

  1. The "Pencil Icon" created by guidorosso on Rive is used in the plugin. This material is provided under CC BY 4.0.
  2. For the promotional video of the plugin, we have used the "Travel Landing Page - Byoerr Web Design" by Misbachul Umam. This video includes modifications to some information and has been translated into Japanese. The original content is provided under CC BY 4.0.


------------------------------------------------------------------------


Dual Font MasterFigma


  3. Auto


  1. AutoRegular
  2. 'mixed'


UI/UX


  1. Rive guidorosso Pencil Icon CC BY 4.0
  2. Misbachul Umam Travel Landing Page - Byoerr Web Design CC BY 4.0
plugins.tagline: This plugin styles English and Japanese text for unified multilingual design.

plugins.name: Marvelous Avatars
plugins.description:
What You Can Expect from This Plugin

  1. Generate Unique Marvel Avatars: Easily create avatars featuring Marvels iconic characters for use in your designs, perfect for adding a heroic touch to user profiles, mockups, and more.
  2. Fill Shapes with Marvel Images: Instantly fill any shape in your Figma design with high-quality images from the Marvel universe, making your designs visually captivating and thematic.
  3. Marvel-Themed Lorem Ipsum: Replace standard placeholder text with fun and engaging Marvel data text, adding character and flair to your design mockups.
  4. Prefilled Data or Real-Time Fetching: Use the plugins prefilled Marvel data for quick access or connect your own Marvel Developer API credentials to fetch collections by name, randomly, or page by page, for the most up-to-date content.


Perfect for Designers Who

  1. Work on projects related to comics, superheroes, or fan sites.
  2. Want to bring a pop culture twist to their design work.
  3. Need unique placeholder content that stands out.
  4. With "Marvelous Avatars," you can quickly integrate Marvels universe into your Figma projects, enhancing your designs with iconic characters and stories.
plugins.tagline: Bring Marvel Universe to your Figma designs

plugins.name: Bulk replacement of text
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to instantly update your table designs by copying and pasting values from spreadsheet applications like Excel or Google Sheets.


The table design can be used whether it is a component or not!


With built-in conditional text formatting, you can automatically apply color rules to your text - for example, displaying positive values in green and negative values in red.

(You can also specify UI library color variables)
plugins.tagline: Bulk rewrite text in your table design.

132561.name: Bulk replacement of text
132561.description:

With built-in conditional text formatting, you can automatically apply color rules to your text - for example, displaying positive values in green and negative values in red.

plugins.name: PixelBin.io
plugins.description:
PixelBin.io (Figma Plugin) is an AI-based image transformation platform that gives you simple tool for asset management and transforming images with high quality. The user can use this plugin for multiple uses such as; Upload/Download images, resizing images, applying filters, sharpening images, removing watermarks, removing background, bulk transformation and much more, right from your Figma (web/desktop).


Stay Connected!

plugins.name: Emailer Plugin. Figma to HTML email
plugins.description:
How we stand out from other similar plugins:

Emailer Plugin does not impose daily, monthly, or other limitations on core features like generating and downloading HTML emails or copying HTML code, unlike other plugins in the Figma Community.


Join our Discord server.


Features you'll love:

A huge library of 250+ design blocks and 64 email templates, with monthly updates

Download generated emails as HTML files or copy the HTML code with no limits

Preview emails in Mobile and Dark Mode

Host images on our Warm B2 Cloud Storage

Export emails to 14 major ESP platforms (ActiveCampaign, Brevo, CampaignMonitor, HubSpot, Klaviyo, MailChimp, Mandrill, Mailgun, MailJet, OneSignal, Postmark, Selzy, SendGrid, SendPulse)

Send test emails to up to 5 inboxes at once to ensure proper rendering across different email clients

Minify and optimize emails with one click to reduce HTML file size

Disable Dark Mode support in emails at any time

Embed your custom HTML code


What about email client support?

HTML emails generated by Emailer Plugin look great in:

Apple Mail (macOS, iOS, iPadOS)

Outlook (Desktop app on macOS/Windows, iOS, Android, Webmail)

Gmail (iOS, Android, Webmail)

Yahoo Mail (iOS, Android, Webmail)

Thunderbird (macOS, Windows)

Proton Mail (iOS, Android, Webmail)

And many others


What else?

Best pricing deal:

We offer the best monthly subscription price and a 30% discount on yearly subscriptions.


Blazing-fast performance:

Speed matters, and weve built the fastest plugin for generating HTML emails. Whether you're working with simple templates or complex, multi-section designs, Emailer Plugin renders everything instantly.


Real-time email preview rendering:

Select an email template, run the plugin, and start customizing your emails content or design. Every change in the Figma frame is rendered in the HTML preview in real time. Want to switch to another template? Just select it on the canvas, and the plugin will instantly re-render it. No need to reload, refresh, or click any extra buttons.


Work in Figma just as you do daily:

The process of creating an email template is the same as working with any other Components or Templates library from the Figma Community.


Choose design blocks from specific Figma frames, compile them into your email template, apply your styles, and run the plugin to generate an HTML preview, download it, copy it, or export it to an ESP platform.


No hidden settings or options in the plugin:

All main actions and options are available on a single screen. We designed the UI to be straightforward, helping you speed up your work. Not slow it down.


Built-in documentation:

17 sections with short how-to videos available anytime you need them. No need to go elsewhere or interrupt your email creation process.


Google fonts support:

Use custom typography to make your emails more visually consistent, personalized, and on-brand. Fonts are applied directly from your email template in Figma to the generated HTML.


Free plan offers:

Unlimited emails download

Unlimited copying of the HTML code

60+ design blocks

Single-column layout

9 starter templates

3 integrations to ESPs (Brevo, HubSpot, OneSignal)

Send 3 test emails per day to one inbox

Google fonts

Basic support


PRO plan offers:

Unlimited emails downloads

Unlimited HTML code copying

250+ design blocks

Multi-column layout

20 PRO templates with monthly updates

13 integrations with ESPs (ActiveCampaign, Brevo, CampaignMonitor, HubSpot, Klaviyo, MailChimp, Mandrill, Mailgun, MailJet, OneSignal, Postmark, Selzy, SendGrid, SendPulse)

Upload images to cloud

Minify HTML code

Send unlimited test emails per day to up to 5 inboxes at once

Embed custom HTML code

Google fonts

Priority support

30% discount on a yearly subscription


Need something extra?

Looking for a custom subscription plan, exclusive design blocks, or a complete email design system tailored to your brand's needs? Let us know and well find a solution.

plugins.tagline: Design and export production-ready HTML emails in minutes, no dev help required.

135663.name: Emailer Plugin. Figma to HTML email
135663.description:
How we stand out from other similar plugins:

Emailer Plugin does not impose daily, monthly, or other limitations on core features like generating and downloading HTML emails or copying HTML code, unlike other plugins in the Figma Community.


Join our Discord server.


Features you'll love:

A huge library of 250+ design blocks and 64 email templates, with monthly updates

Download generated emails as HTML files or copy the HTML code with no limits

Preview emails in Mobile and Dark Mode

Host images on our Warm B2 Cloud Storage

Export emails to 14 major ESP platforms (ActiveCampaign, Brevo, CampaignMonitor, HubSpot, Klaviyo, MailChimp, Mandrill, Mailgun, MailJet, OneSignal, Postmark, Selzy, SendGrid, SendPulse)

Send test emails to up to 5 inboxes at once to ensure proper rendering across different email clients

Minify and optimize emails with one click to reduce HTML file size

Disable Dark Mode support in emails at any time

Embed your custom HTML code


What about email client support?

HTML emails generated by Emailer Plugin look great in:

Apple Mail (macOS, iOS, iPadOS)

Outlook (Desktop app on macOS/Windows, iOS, Android, Webmail)

Gmail (iOS, Android, Webmail)

Yahoo Mail (iOS, Android, Webmail)

Thunderbird (macOS, Windows)

Proton Mail (iOS, Android, Webmail)

And many others


What else?

Best pricing deal:

We offer the best monthly subscription price and a 30% discount on yearly subscriptions.


Blazing-fast performance:

Speed matters, and weve built the fastest plugin for generating HTML emails. Whether you're working with simple templates or complex, multi-section designs, Emailer Plugin renders everything instantly.


Real-time email preview rendering:

Select an email template, run the plugin, and start customizing your emails content or design. Every change in the Figma frame is rendered in the HTML preview in real time. Want to switch to another template? Just select it on the canvas, and the plugin will instantly re-render it. No need to reload, refresh, or click any extra buttons.


Work in Figma just as you do daily:

The process of creating an email template is the same as working with any other Components or Templates library from the Figma Community.


Choose design blocks from specific Figma frames, compile them into your email template, apply your styles, and run the plugin to generate an HTML preview, download it, copy it, or export it to an ESP platform.


No hidden settings or options in the plugin:

All main actions and options are available on a single screen. We designed the UI to be straightforward, helping you speed up your work. Not slow it down.


Built-in documentation:

17 sections with short how-to videos available anytime you need them. No need to go elsewhere or interrupt your email creation process.


Google fonts support:

Use custom typography to make your emails more visually consistent, personalized, and on-brand. Fonts are applied directly from your email template in Figma to the generated HTML.


Free plan offers:

Unlimited emails download

Unlimited copying of the HTML code

60+ design blocks

Single-column layout

9 starter templates

3 integrations to ESPs (Brevo, HubSpot, OneSignal)

Send 3 test emails per day to one inbox

Google fonts

Basic support


PRO plan offers:

Unlimited emails downloads

Unlimited HTML code copying

250+ design blocks

Multi-column layout

20 PRO templates with monthly updates

13 integrations with ESPs (ActiveCampaign, Brevo, CampaignMonitor, HubSpot, Klaviyo, MailChimp, Mandrill, Mailgun, MailJet, OneSignal, Postmark, Selzy, SendGrid, SendPulse)

Upload images to cloud

Minify HTML code

Send unlimited test emails per day to up to 5 inboxes at once

Embed custom HTML code

Google fonts

Priority support

30% discount on a yearly subscription


Need something extra?

Looking for a custom subscription plan, exclusive design blocks, or a complete email design system tailored to your brand's needs? Let us know and well find a solution.


Email us at sergio@emailerplugin.io or join our Discord server.

networkAccess.reasoning: Emailer Plugin connects to emailerplugin.io to validate PRO user licenses and fetch assets for faster loading. It accesses googleapis.com to render Google Fonts, integrates with backblaze.com for optional image hosting, and allows HTML exports to various email marketing platforms via their APIs.

plugins.name: Export to WebP
plugins.description:
Export to WebP transforms your Figma frames into optimised WebP images with just a few clicks.


WebP offers significantly smaller file sizes compared to PNG while maintaining excellent visual quality - perfect for web projects where performance matters.


Key Features


Smart Target File Size Optimisation NEW

Set your desired file size (e.g., "100 KB" or "2 MB") and let the plugin automatically find the perfect quality setting

Advanced binary search algorithm optimises quality to hit your exact target size

Real-time progress feedback shows optimisation iterations

Perfect for meeting specific file size requirements or bandwidth constraints

Advanced Transparency Control NEW

Preserve or remove alpha channel (transparency) based on your needs

Keep transparent backgrounds for overlays and UI elements

Remove transparency for smaller file sizes when opacity isn't needed

Smart default settings optimize for most common use cases


Efficient WebP Conversion

Convert any Figma element to WebP format with high-quality results

Save up to 30-75% in file size compared to PNG format

Maintain visual quality while dramatically reducing file sizes


Flexible Quality Settings

Choose from preset quality options (High Quality, Web Optimised, Ultra Compressed)

Fine-tune compression with a precise quality slider (0-100%)

Create and save custom quality presets for your specific needs


Batch Processing

Convert multiple elements simultaneously

Real-time progress tracking with accurate completion estimates

Optimised memory usage for handling large selections


Export Options

Save as a single ZIP file containing all WebP images

Download individual WebP files directly

Automatic naming based on your Figma layer structure


Detailed Statistics

View before/after file size comparisons

See exact file size savings for each conversion

Track total compression savings across your selection


Simple Workflow

Select elements Choose quality Convert Download

Integrates seamlessly with your Figma workflow

Works with frames, components, groups, shapes, text, and more


Performance Optimised

Fast conversions even for high-resolution graphics

Memory-efficient processing for large batches


Please leave some feedback if you find this plugin useful :)
plugins.tagline: Convert your designs to WebP - smaller files, same quality

plugins.name: Clear Bottom
plugins.description:
Clear Bottom: A Simple Figma Plugin for Lazy Designers


Hello Figma Community!


Im excited to introduce my new plugin, Clear Bottom, crafted for those who want to simplify their workflow without any development experience.


What is Clear Bottom?


Clear Bottom is a straightforward Figma plugin designed to tackle a common issue: the empty area at the bottom of your frames. If youve ever faced the frustration of manually adjusting each frame to remove these gaps, this plugin is here to help.


How Does It Work?


  1. Select Multiple Frames (Or single): Choose the frames with gaps at the bottom.
  2. Run the Plugin: Clear Bottom automatically removes the empty space at the bottom of each selected frame.
  3. Preserves Design Elements: Your design elements stay in place and unchanged.


Feel free to provide feedback or ask questions. I hope this plugin makes your design process a bit smoother!


Happy designing!
plugins.tagline: Clear empty bottom space in Figma frames effortlessly, without moving or resizing elements in them.

100108.name: Clear Bottom
100108.description:

What is Clear Bottom?

How Does It Work?


  1. Select Multiple Frames (Or single): Choose the frames with gaps at the bottom.
  2. Run the Plugin: Clear Bottom automatically removes the empty space at the bottom of each selected frame.
  3. Preserves Design Elements: Your design elements stay in place and unchanged.


Feel free to provide feedback or ask questions. I hope this plugin makes your design process a bit smoother!


Happy designing!
100108.tagline: Clear empty bottom space in Figma frames effortlessly, without moving or resizing elements in them.

plugins.name: Detach Local Components
plugins.description:
This plug-in detaches all instances and their children if their main components are defined in this file, while preserving the instances of library components. It is developed for designers who use a design system to take a snapshot of their design during iteration.


How to use:

  1. Select anything contains instances
  2. Run the plug-in


Limitation: If a local instance is inside of a library instance, it will be not be detached.


NOTE: You are responsible for testing the plug-in before use or keeping a copy of your file to prevent any potential damage. If you need to undo the detach, use Ctrl + Z.
plugins.tagline: Detach instances of local components while keeping external ones intact

plugins.name: bboxify
plugins.description:
Tools like Nuke often require bounding boxes to position, crop, animate (etc.) elements. One way to send bounding box values to Nuke is bundling the x/y positions, width and height into a comma-separated string, such as:

"1189.390625,492,379.609375,78"


The order of these values is always the same:

  1. x position
  2. y position
  3. width
  4. height


The bounding box can be previewed based on this in tools like Nuke, however, if these values are generated and sent from eg. a Javascript app, it could get a little tricky to accurately view and check these bounding boxes as they may be influenced by certain CSS parameters.


This little plugin aims to solve this. Drop an image into Figma on which you'd like to check the bounding boxes, then right-click on it -> Plugins -> bboxify to start the plugin. You can search for it and install it from Figma's Community page if you don't have it yet.


After starting the plugin, all you need to do it enter the bounding box values into the input field. 4 values (following the above-mentioned order) represent one full rectangle. Make sure each value is separated by a comma.


You may also enter more than 4 values in which case more than one rectangle will be created. For example, if you enter 12 values, 3 rectangles will be created (as 3x4 = 12), which may be useful if you're generating bounding boxes around each character of a text element. The order of each value will be the same in this case as well, just repeated:

  1. x position of 1st rectangle
  2. y position of 1st rectangle
  3. width of 1st rectangle
  4. height of 1st rectangle
  5. x position of 2nd rectangle
  6. y position of 2nd rectangle
  7. width of 2nd rectangle
  8. height of 2nd rectangle


etc.


This means you don't have to manually create rectangles one-by-one in Figma to double-check the accuracy of the boxes you generate on the frontend.
plugins.tagline: Create rectangles based on comma-separated bounding box values

63620.name: bboxify
63620.description:
Tools like Nuke often require bounding boxes to position, crop, animate (etc.) elements. One way to send bounding box values to Nuke is bundling the x/y positions, width and height into a comma-separated string, such as:

"1189.390625,492,379.609375,78"


The order of these values is always the same:

  1. x position
  2. y position
  3. width
  4. height


The bounding box can be previewed based on this in tools like Nuke, however, if these values are generated and sent from eg. a Javascript app, it could get a little tricky to accurately view and check these bounding boxes as they may be influenced by certain CSS parameters.


This little plugin aims to solve this. Drop an image into Figma on which you'd like to check the bounding boxes, then right-click on it -> Plugins -> bboxify to start the plugin. You can search for it and install it from Figma's Community page if you don't have it yet.


After starting the plugin, all you need to do it enter the bounding box values into the input field. 4 values (following the above-mentioned order) represent one full rectangle. Make sure each value is separated by a comma.


You may also enter more than 4 values in which case more than one rectangle will be created. For example, if you enter 12 values, 3 rectangles will be created (as 3x4 = 12), which may be useful if you're generating bounding boxes around each character of a text element. The order of each value will be the same in this case as well, just repeated:

  1. x position of 1st rectangle
  2. y position of 1st rectangle
  3. width of 1st rectangle
  4. height of 1st rectangle
  5. x position of 2nd rectangle
  6. y position of 2nd rectangle
  7. width of 2nd rectangle
  8. height of 2nd rectangle


etc.


This means you don't have to manually create rectangles one-by-one in Figma to double-check the accuracy of the boxes you generate on the frontend.
63620.release_notes: Added error messages in case user enters insufficient or incorrect values in one of the fields + minor UI tweaks
63620.tagline: Create rectangles based on comma-separated bounding box values

plugins.name: Devstimates
plugins.description:
Enable devs and designers to provide estimates for components and export them to a CSV.

-----------------------------------

- Start the plugin
- Click on any frame
- Add new line item and provide a label and value

plugins.name: Lilly Icon - Free Rive Animated & Static Icons
plugins.description:
What is Lilly Icon?

Lilly Icon is a free and growing collection of static and Rive animated icons. With this Figma plugin, you can easily insert static icons into your designs. For development phase, animated Rive (.riv) versions are available on the Lilly Icon website to bring your projects to life.


Is it really free?

Yescompletely free! No paywalls or sign-ups. All icons are licensed under Creative Commons BY 4.0, including the animated ones.


Thanks to your donations, Lilly keeps expanding with more icons and new features.


Created and maintained with love by Sajjad Dashti graphic, product, and motion designer.

Questions? Reach out at hi@sajjaddashti.ir.
plugins.tagline: Add static Lilly icons to Figma designs with quick search and easy insert.

plugins.name: Figma to Kontakt
plugins.description:
Implementing UIs in KSP has been painful manual process, until now.


Using F2K's visual syntax in your designs, you can generate the implementation code and speed up your workflow by at least a couple orders of magnitude.


F2K now has a custom Font Generator module that allows adjustment of horizontal character spacing, vertical offset, it has a monospace option and supports text effects!


https://figmatokontakt.com - sign up and get rolling. FREE!


General tutorial dropped!

https://youtu.be/D7lqAV1KRKw

plugins.name: Connect Styles
plugins.description:
Color styles sometimes get detached. It can be time consuming to manually reconnect them all.


Connect Styles is the super easy fix for this:


1) Scan your page for detached Color Styles

2) Reconnect colors to their Color Styles


That's it! You can either reconnect all Color Styles at once, or one at the time for more control.


Pricing

You can use this plugin 3 times for free. Figma doesn't allow paid plugins to go cheaper dan $2 per month. Thats why the yearly plan has a discount of 63%, so that the total price of a license is only $8,88


Cancelation


Subscriptions are handled by Figma. You can cancel the plugin subscription by:


Clicking your profile avatar in the top-left corner of Figma

Click Settings

Click Community and find the section Community purchases.

Click the three dots ... next to Skew It Let's Do It

Click Manage subscription

In the newly opened Stripe portal, select Cancel Plan


Cheers and stay connected!
plugins.tagline: Reconnect detached Color Styles

109325.description:

plugins.name: Typography Analyzer
plugins.description:
Typography Optimizer is the ultimate plugin for UI designers looking to enhance their text layers with precision and efficiency.


It focuses exclusively on analyzing text, skipping empty layers and frames, and provides actionable suggestions for improving font usage, line heights, and contrast.


Ensure your designs follow UI best practices and accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG 2.1) while maintaining consistency with your design system.


Typography Optimizer simplifies typography management for flawless, user-friendly designs.

Im think about changing the '1-2 character' scheme to allow for the custom selection of short words or prepositions like 'the', 'of', 'not', etc.

plugins.name: Hapticlabs - Add haptic feedback to Figma prototypes
plugins.description:
Add Haptics to your Figma prototypes!


Have you also been missing purring buttons or clicky toggles in your prototypes? Look no further and get ready for tangible interactions.


Features:

Native interactions: Add haptics to On click interactions on both frame or component level

Easy to use: Use our plugin to easily add, configure or toggle haptics in existing prototypes

Cross Platform: Works on both iOS and Android devices

Highly customisable: Create your own custom haptic effects with Hapticlabs Studio


How to use

Visit our Playground file for step by step instructions.


Learn more about Hapticlabs.io and follow us on LinkedIn.


Feedback & Support:

We would love to hear your thoughts! For feedback or assistance, please contact us at support@hapticlabs.io

accepted.description: Easily design, prototype and integrate haptics!

plugins.name: LZ Rename All Frames
plugins.description:
Figma Plugin that helps you rename all frames in your file with a custom name and adds an increment counter to each frame.


With this you give a name to be used for reaming and it simply names your layers with the inputed name and ads a number.


eg If Name is given as Authentication the file names will be Authentication 1, Authentication 2 etc


How to use

  1. Run plugin
  2. Enter frame name ( optional )
  3. Click rename

accepted.name: Ogar Emmanuel
accepted.description:
UI UX designer at night, print designer during the day.
Follow me on instagram if you got questions or need more of my designs

plugins.name: GPT
plugins.description:
Unleash Your Creativity With ChatGPT


ChatGPT



1.

2.

3. ChatGPT



Welcome to Design Toolkit!


This plugin can help you quickly create your own ChatGPT toolkit, allowing your creativity to come to life at any time!


The instructions for use are very simple, requiring only a few steps:

  1. Open the plugin and select "Create Toolkit".
  2. Add dialogue content and specify the settings for the scene and characters.
  3. Click "Generate" to quickly obtain your own ChatGPT toolkit!


In addition, this plugin plans to support multimodal interaction and document summarization in the future, making your creativity more flexible and diverse.


Whether you are a designer or a creator, you can use this plugin to create your own work and expand your inspiration limitlessly!

plugins.name: Interlinked
plugins.description:
Interlined makes it easy to navigate in Design Mode within Figma file, even across pages.


When you run Interlinked for the first time, it will create interlink component for you.


Restyle your links

You can change the component whatever you like, but it must have interlink text node to work.


Use your components

You can also use Interlinked with your components of choice, as long as they have a text node named 'interlink'. Select 2 instances and run Interlined from the Command Palette (`Cmd+/`).


Set default component

Now when you run the plugin on custom components you can set is as default from toast notification. Next time you run Interlined without selection, links will be created using new components.


Fix broken link

Links can and will bet broken when you change the text of the link, or if you copy and paste the node. Run the plugin from the Design Panel, then the node is selected to get the link fixed.


Works with interactions

You can enable Presentation mode interactions from the Design Panel and the page level. Its off by default because it can lead to a messy workspace, and Figma creates a starting point, which you probably don't need.
plugins.tagline: Link two nodes together to navigate in Design mode. Within Figma Interlinked. Interlinked.

85245.name: Interlinked
85245.description:
Interlined makes it easy to navigate in Design Mode within Figma file, even across pages.


When you run Interlinked for the first time, it will create interlink component for you.


Restyle your links

You can change the component whatever you like, but it must have interlink text node to work.


Use your components

You can also use Interlinked with your components of choice, as long as they have a text node named 'interlink'. Select 2 instances and run Interlined from the Command Palette (`Cmd+/`).


Set default component

Now when you run the plugin on custom components you can set is as default from toast notification. Next time you run Interlined without selection, links will be created using new components.


Fix broken link

Links can and will bet broken when you change the text of the link, or if you copy and paste the node. Run the plugin from the Design Panel, then the node is selected to get the link fixed.


Works with interactions

You can enable Presentation mode interactions from the Design Panel and the page level. Its off by default because it can lead to a messy workspace, and Figma creates a starting point, which you probably don't need.
85245.release_notes: fixing presentation mode on-click linking as it was borked by the changes in Figma API. Should be good now, but remember that presentation mode interactions are off by default and you have to toggle the thing after you first use the plugin.
85245.tagline: Link two nodes together to navigate in Design mode. Within Figma Interlinked. Interlinked.
